title: Hanging, "Sienna", ca. 1925
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: plain weave foundation, seamed in center; resist, dyed using wax
signed: Signature: Stylized motif of a beech tree and initials L.B.B. & H. indicating artist was married to Francis Head when piece was made.
inscribed: Label sewn to back left corner "Sienna by Lydia-Bush Brown" with printed address 129 East 10th Street, New York. N.Y. 10003.
creditline: Gift of the Estate of Lydia Bush-Brown Head
description: View of Sienna, Italy, and surrounding countryside. The cathedral and bell tower in the background, a portion of the Campo in the center and small buildings and trees in the foreground, in gray, pink, salmon, and yellow. Border in white, gray and yellow on a red ground: at top, baskets of fruit; left and right sides, hitching posts for Palio alternate with fruit baskets; at bottom, bullocks drawing carts.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, "Sienna", ca. 1925.
ca. 1925. Medium: silk
Technique: plain weave foundation, seamed in center; resist, dyed using wax. Gift of the Estate of Lydia Bush-Brown Head. 1985-2-4.
